Name: sodium tetrafluoroborate production, sodium tetrahydridoborate fluorination | diborane | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: Sodium tetrahydridoborate fluorination is one of the most important processes to produce diborane. The method preferred for the commercial preparation of diborane is the addition of boron trifluoride to a stirred solution of sodium tetrahydridoborate in diethylene glycol dimethyl ether (diglyme): ;Diborane is shipped either as a compressed gas (ambient) or as a liquid (cylinder over packaged with dry ice). It is packaged as a hazardous material regulated by the DOT. ;References:;Brotherton, R..: Boron Compounds. Published online: 2000. In: Ullmann's Ency-clopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Seventh Edition, 2004 Electronic Release (ed. Fiedler E., Grossmann G., Kersebohm D., Weiss G. and Witte C.). 7 th Electronic Release Edition.
